diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with acute onset of epigastric and right upper quadrant pain, fever, chills, and nausea, which are consistent with acute cholecystitis. An ultrasound exam revealed a distended gallbladder with sludge and a 1.3 cm echogenic structure indicative of an immobile gallstone, supporting the diagnosis. The patient described the pain as different from previous episodes related to GERD.
